1:
Why are times for judging wicked people not set by the Almighty?\q Why do not those who are faithful to God see his days of judgment come?


\q
2:
There are wicked people who remove boundary markers;\q there are wicked people who take away flocks by force and put them in their own pastures.
\q
3:
They drive away the donkey of those without fathers;\q they take the widow's ox as security.
\q
4:
They force needy people out of their path;\q poor people of the earth all hide themselves from them.


\q
6:
Poor people reap in the night in other people's fields;\q they glean grapes from the harvest of those wicked people.
\q
7:
They lie naked all night without clothing;\q they have no covering in the cold.


\q
8:
They are wet with the showers of the mountains;\q they lie next to large rocks because they have no shelter.
\q
9:
There are wicked people who pluck orphans from their mothers' breast,\q and wicked people who take children as security from poor people.
\q
10:
But the poor people go about naked without clothing;\q although they go hungry, they carry others' sheaves of grain.


\q
11:
The poor people make oil within the walls of those wicked men;\q they tread the wicked men's winepresses, but they themselves suffer thirst.
\q
12:
In the city people groan;\q the wounded people cry out,
\q but God pays no attention to their prayers.
\m


\q
13:
Some of these wicked people rebel against the light;\q they know not its ways,
\q nor do they stay in its paths.
\q
15:
Also, the eye of the adulterer waits for the twilight;\q he says, 'No eye will see me.'
\q He disguises his face.
\q
17:
For all of them, thick darkness is like the morning;\q for they are friends with the terrors of thick darkness.
\m


\q
19:
As drought and heat melt away the snow into waters, \q so Sheol takes away those who have sinned.


\q
21:
The wicked one devours the barren women who have not borne children;\q he does no good to the widow.


\q
22:
Yet God drags away the mighty people by his power;\q he rises up and does not strengthen them in life.
\q
23:
God allows them to think they are secure, and they are happy about that,\q but his eyes are on their ways.


\q
25: If it is not so, who can prove me to be a liar;\q who can make my speech worth nothing?"
